AfterImpFight.synopsis: Companion Lae'zel or (alt gith if Laezel is avatar) will approach the player after spotting the player as she spies on some imps. During the dialogue she has a mindmeld with the player but brushes it aside.
AfterImpFight.how_to_trigger: Interact with Imp Room door in TUT_Avernus_C -46; 6; -413

PAD_AfterFight.synopsis: Comment on how they should get to the helm. Triggered after the imp fight on the lower deck and if the gith guide is not there.

AltGuide_Stairs.synopsis: cautions the player to blend in with the chaos on the upper deck to not get in trouble.

PAD_ReactionToDragonAttack.synopsis: PAD in tutorial when crossing the imp room and a dragon attack with fire happens in the background. Player urges to keep going forward.
PAD_ReactionToDragonAttack.how_to_trigger: Start in TUT_Avernus_CFinish starting cinematicGet close to -42; 4; -362

AD_LaezelAfterFight.synopsis: Lae'zel tells player in the tutorial you should head to the helm.

AD_UsWaitingAtEntrance.synopsis: One liner AD copying an existing line from TUT_Lab_DevourerFollower dialog. This line gets called when players send Us, as follower, near the entrance of imp room without they themselves going in and triggering Laezel/Losiir recruitment dialog. In order to stop him from going in the imp room before players meet Laezel, he will stop being follower, say this line and stay there until players go where he is, triggering said dialog and making him follower again for imp room combat.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight.synopsis: Gith Guide encourages player to get to the helm. Has a mindmeld with the player but brushes it aside.

LaezelStairs.synopsis: Lae'zel tells you to pretend you are enthralled as you reach the staircase.

AD_AltGuide_AfterFight.synopsis: After a big fight, urging player to keep moving.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: We observed that several sessions occur as a reaction to the imp fight and the events immediately following it. The tutorial first presents a moment where the player experiences a dragon attack in the imp room (PAD_ReactionToDragonAttack), which happens before engaging in any post‐fight dialogues. After the fight the game branches depending on which companion or guide is active. In one branch the Lae'zel dialogue sequence is triggered: first AfterImpFight (when Lae'zel – or her alternate if Lae'zel is the avatar – approaches the player), then Lae'zel provides further directions in AD_LaezelAfterFight. Additionally, there is a session PAD_AfterFight that comments on heading for the helm; this session is triggered only if the Gith guide is not present, effectively belonging to the Lae'zel branch. In the other branch the Gith guide is present and directs the player: first AltGuide_AfterImpFight, then he continues in AD_AltGuide_AfterFight. Later on, when the player reaches the upper deck staircase, a branch‐specific caution or instruction is given. If the Lae'zel branch was chosen the session LaezelStairs is used, whereas if the alternate guide branch was followed then AltGuide_Stairs appears. This makes the two stairs sessions mutually exclusive. Also, PAD_AfterFight and AltGuide_AfterImpFight do not occur together because their triggering conditions are mutually exclusive (presence versus absence of the Gith guide).

AfterImpFight_6.speaker: Narrator
AfterImpFight_6.text: Another survivor. We may yet see an end to this torment.

AfterImpFight_1.speaker: Narrator
AfterImpFight_1.text: *Your head throbs and your skin tingles. Visions rush past: a dragon's wing, a silver sword - and a flash of your face seen through the strange man's eyes.*

AfterImpFight_2.text: By Vlaakith's touch, what is this?

AfterImpFight_12.text: Tsk'va. The parasite has already taken hold. We must take to a crèche and be cleansed.

AfterImpFight_22.text: But first, we must get to the helm.

AfterImpFight_28.text: No - forget it. We must ready ourselves for battle. There are imps blocking our path.

AfterImpFight_15.text: We need to get rid of them and seek out the helm.

AfterImpFight_23.text: It's where we gain control over the ship. We must travel the planes - leave Avernus, before these imps tear us apart.

AfterImpFight_44.speaker: Player
AfterImpFight_44.text: So they put a parasite in your eye, too?

AfterImpFight_38.text: Yes, we risk turning into mind flayers. But purification will have to wait until we take control of the ship.

AfterImpFight_21.text: We're in Avernus. First of the Nine Hells.

AfterImpFight_19.speaker: Player
AfterImpFight_19.text: I know this place. We are in Avernus, first of the Nine Hells.

AfterImpFight_30.text: Then you'll understand why we must leave at once.

AfterImpFight_25.speaker: Narrator
AfterImpFight_25.text: Lae'zel - you still live! May the Queen's favour be yours.

AfterImpFight_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel leaps down from an awning overhead, appearing in front of the playe with dagger in hand. It is an ambush.

AfterImpFight_41.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel hovers over with  with hostility, dagger raised, appearing to be trying to kill you.

AfterImpFight_10.speaker: Narrator
AfterImpFight_10.text: *Your head throbs and your skin tingles. Visions rush past: a dragon's wing, a silver sword - and a flash of your face seen through the strange woman's eyes.*
AfterImpFight_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld animation-- player clutches their head

AfterImpFight_13.text: My head. What is this... ngh.
AfterImpFight_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel clutches her headNodeContext: Lae'zel is experiencing her first mindmeld. She is well-versed in illithid matters and realizes htis mindmeld is due to the parasites in your heads.

AfterImpFight_3.text: Tsk'va. You are no thrall - Vlaakith blesses me this day! Together we might survive.

AfterImpFight_9.speaker: Narrator
AfterImpFight_9.text: *The artefact. You and others were to seize it from the githyanki. She may prove to be a foe, but for now offers aid...*

AfterImpFight_20.speaker: Player
AfterImpFight_20.text: What made you think I was a thrall?

AfterImpFight_16.text: We carry mind flayer parasites. Unless we escape - unless we are cleansed - our bodies and minds will be tainted and twisted.

AfterImpFight_18.text: Within days, we will be ghaik. Mind flayers.

AfterImpFight_40.speaker: Player
AfterImpFight_40.text: We are turning into mind flayers? There must be something we can do!

AfterImpFight_8.text: We can do nothing until we escape - that must be our priority.

AfterImpFight_4.text: Who am I? Your only chance of survival.

AfterImpFight_11.speaker: Player
AfterImpFight_11.text: We need to figure out where we are.

AfterImpFight_45.text: First, we exterminate the imps. Then we find the helm and take control of the ship.

AfterImpFight_29.text: As for that thing - it will remain tame as long as it believes we are thralls. It may be of use in the fight to come.
AfterImpFight_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the intellect devourer follower

AfterImpFight_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Imps scavenging around corpses look up.

AfterImpFight_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Players move into position for combat. Lae'zel and player in parallel.

AfterImpFight_0.text: We will address the matter of a cure for this infection once we reach the Material Plane.

AltGuide_Stairs_0.speaker: Losiir
AltGuide_Stairs_0.text: Chaos beyond. We must feign that we are thralls like the others.

PAD_ReactionToDragonAttack_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ReactionToDragonAttack_0.text: The ship won't be able to take another dragon attack. We need to get out before it's too late.

AD_LaezelAfterFight_0.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelAfterFight_0.text: You prove surprisingly adequate in battle.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_24.speaker: Losiir
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_24.text: Another survivor. We may yet see an end to this torment.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_1.speaker: Lae'zel
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_1.text: Losiir. I see you've earned your robes.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_51.speaker: Narrator
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_51.text: *Your head throbs and your skin tingles. Visions rush past: a dragon's wing, a silver sword - and a flash of your face seen through the strange man's eyes.*

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_42.speaker: Losiir
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_42.text: By Vlaakith's touch, what is this?

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_4.speaker: Losiir
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_4.text: Tsk'va. The parasite has already taken hold. We must take to a crèche and be cleansed.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_29.speaker: Losiir
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_29.text: But first, we must get to the helm.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_44.speaker: Losiir
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_44.text: No - forget it. We must ready ourselves for battle. There are imps blocking our path.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_10.speaker: Losiir
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_10.text: We need to get rid of them and seek out the helm.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_54.speaker: Losiir
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_54.text: It's where we gain control over the ship. We must travel the planes - leave Avernus, before these imps tear us apart.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_43.speaker: Player
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_43.text: So they put a parasite in your eye, too?

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_8.speaker: Losiir
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_8.text: Yes, we risk turning into mind flayers. But purification will have to wait until we take control of the ship.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_6.speaker: Losiir
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_6.text: We're in Avernus. First of the Nine Hells.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Imps scavenging around corpses look up.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player moves into position for combat. Gith guide leads.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_13.speaker: Losiir
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_13.text: Very well - if you are fit to lead, our victory will be the proof!

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player moves into position for combat. Player in the lead.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_34.speaker: Player
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_34.text: I'll pick them off from the shadows. They won't even know I was there.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_21.speaker: Player
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_21.text: The hunt begins... You lead, I'll cover you.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_47.speaker: Losiir
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_47.text: Mark your prey, and we will split them open!

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_0.speaker: Player
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_0.text: You ready your weapon, I will ready my spells.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_2.speaker: Losiir
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_2.text: May the wounds you inflict match those of my blade!

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_14.speaker: Player
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_14.text: They stand in the way of the divine's will - they must be slain.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_40.speaker: Player
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_40.text: On my oath - let us slay these foul creatures.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_3.speaker: Player
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_3.text: We shall cast them into the void.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_19.speaker: Player
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_19.text: I need no weapon. My veins flow with arcane power.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_16.speaker: Losiir
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_16.text: Then unleash it upon these infernal minions!

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Players move into position for combat. Gith guide and player in parallel.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_28.speaker: Losiir
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_28.text: Make them tremble with your music's fury!

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_17.speaker: Player
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_17.text: Close your eyes. Breathe deep. Prepare to fight.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_39.speaker: Losiir
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_39.text: Good. Now go, and make every strike count!

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_26.speaker: Player
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_26.text: I know this place. We are in Avernus, first of the Nine Hells.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_12.speaker: Losiir
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_12.text: Then you'll understand why we must leave at once.

AltGuide_AfterImpFight_35.speaker: Losiir
AltGuide_AfterImpFight_35.text: Lae'zel - you still live! May the Queen's favour be yours.

LaezelStairs_2.speaker: Lae'zel
LaezelStairs_2.text: Listen closely istik: There will be ghaik - mind flayers - ahead. If they speak, do as they say. We must not reveal our minds are our own.

LaezelStairs_3.speaker: Player
LaezelStairs_3.text: As you wish: I will follow their commands.

LaezelStairs_1.speaker: Lae'zel
LaezelStairs_1.text: I would expect so. It is the one path to our purification.

LaezelStairs_4.speaker: Player
LaezelStairs_4.text: I take orders from no one. Not mind flayers, and not you.

LaezelStairs_5.speaker: Lae'zel
LaezelStairs_5.text: Is your ego so thin you would submit to slaughter by ghaik hands? Such is your fate if you refuse them.
